elements.textContent:
The Black Death (1346-1353): Killed 75-200 million people in Europe and Asia.
Spanish Flu (1918-1920): Infected 500 million people worldwide and resulted in 50 million deaths.
HIV/AIDS (1981-Present): 32 million deaths and 38 million people living with HIV globally.
COVID-19 (2019-Present): Over 6.8 million deaths worldwide, with long-term effects still unknown.
Pandemics cause widespread illness, death, economic disruption, and social instability.
They highlight the importance of public health infrastructure and global cooperation.
